org.mundo.rt
Class ObjectAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.ObjectAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IReceiver
public class ObjectAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements IReceiver

An object adapter is the glue between subscribers and target objects. Object adapters are necessary on the server side when using remote method calls.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler

Constructor Detail

ObjectAdapter

public ObjectAdapter(Subscriber sub,
                     java.lang.Object target)
Initializes a new object adapter.

Parameters:
sub - the subscriber object that defines where requests to the object come from. The subscriber must not be already enabled.
target - the local target object.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

received

public void received(Message msg,
                     MessageContext msgCtx)
This callback is called on an incoming RMC request. The method finds a suitable server stub and invokes the method specified in the request on the target object.

Specified by:
received in interface IReceiver
Parameters:
msg - the RMC request message.
msgCtx - the message context.

invoke

public TypedMap invoke(TypedMap m)
Performs the invocation specified by the map object.
